phrase.item: I have another story that is again about the Ayta and the straight­haired people.
It's said that back in the early days, our hair was just the same as straight-haired people.
So the ancestors discussed that they would do something - something surprising.
When they were all there at their meeting place, this one ancestor said, "We will do something so that our hair will not be just the same.
But someone asked, "What will we do so that (our) hair will become curly?
The elder said, what he said is, "Two (things) each one of us will choose from.
Whoever runs there to the curly plant, he will become curly-haired.
But whoever runs there to the cogon grass, his hair will not be affected and he will then become straight-haired forever.
So think over where you want (to go)."
So each one thought over where they would run to.
When they had finished deciding, the elder said, "I will count to three, then we will all run.
When he had finished counting, then they all ran.
Some went to the curly plant.
But others went to the cogon grass.
When that was finished, they went back home.
But their hair didn't become curly right away.
When they went to their work, each one as they worked, little by little their hair was now curling, those who ran to the curly plant.
So from then on, there have been curly-haired (people).
